<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/01/essential-workers-look-clarity-around-vaccinations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Essential Doesn't Always Mean Priority
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Vaccines for essential workers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTE2L3ZhY2NpbmVzX2Zvcl9lc3NlbnRpYWxfd29ya2Vycy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the last two months, the US has administered about 30 million doses of coronavirus vaccines, with daily pricks now averaging 1.3+ million. Steady progress...but even as vaccinations tick up, millions of essential workers <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2021/01/31/covid-vaccine-who-should-go-first/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don't have clarity</a> around when it's their turn.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The lines are blurry  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Concerns about a slow rollout prompted the Trump and Biden administrations to support expanding eligibility to all adults 65+ and frontline workers. Some states, including Texas and Florida, began vaccinating senior citizens as early as December. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Kaiser Family Foundation estimates that in at least 35 states, frontline workers have been prioritized with or behind older people. That’s prompted some </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2021-01-26/as-californis-shifts-to-age-based-covid-19-vaccine-essential-workers-disabled-n?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debate</a></span><span> about using age-based factors vs. occupational risk and underlying health concerns. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There's a case for both. </strong>The panel that advises the CDC about vaccine priority recommended that, after healthcare personnel, frontline workers (who are more likely to contract and spread Covid) and adults 75+ (who are more likely to get serious complications and fill up ICUs) should get shots.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There's also a question of equity</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Essential workers, a disproportionate number of whom are people of color and immigrants, have experienced higher rates of Covid. Preliminary results of a UCSF study <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pandemic-wears-on-essential-workers-everybody-forgets-that-youre-still-on-the-front-line-11612197832?mod=hp_lead_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found</a> a 39% increase in deaths among food and agriculture workers (compared to 22% among workers in general). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday, the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-01/democrats-probe-tyson-smithfield-osha-over-covid-outbreaks?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a></span><span> a probe into meatpacking plants operated by Tyson, Smithfield, and JBS. Almost 54,000 meatpacking employees have gotten sick, and at least 270 have died. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Uncertainty over vaccines is yet another challenge for essential workers, many of whom are in a precarious financial position. While many grocery and retail giants recorded record profits during the pandemic, <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/blog/the-avenue/2021/01/27/local-covid-19-hazard-pay-mandates-are-doing-what-congress-and-most-corporations-arent-for-essential-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hazard pay</a> for most grocery workers ran out months ago, even as the pandemic worsened.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> The struggle to immunize the heroes of the pandemic highlights the logistical, political, and moral questions around distributing a limited number of life-saving vaccines.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/01/republican-senators-meet-biden-relief-counterproposal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Do You Want to Build a Stimulus Proposal?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A snowman is seen on the North Lawn of the White House in Washington, DC, February 1, 2021." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTE3L3Nub3dtYW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Saul Loeb/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maybe hot cocoa and a snow day can bridge the deepest of divides. Yesterday, a group of Republican senators snowshoed over to the White House to discuss their <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/31/962554923/10-senate-republicans-plan-to-detail-slimmed-down-covid-19-counteroffer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$618 billion counterproposal</a> to President Biden's $1.9 trillion relief bill. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are some familiar pieces inside, including: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$160 billion for vaccines, Covid testing and tracing, and PPE</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$220 billion for direct payments of up to $1,000 to some individuals (Biden has pushed for $1,400 payments)</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$132 billion for extra unemployment benefits through June (Biden's would run through September)</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Additional funds for the PPP and reopening schools </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's not: </strong>The counterproposal leaves out a $15 federal minimum wage and aid for state/local governments.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">10 Republicans are behind the proposal...precisely the number Democrats may need on their side to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/29/will-democrats-finally-nix-filibuster?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prevent a filibuster</a>. Democrats can pass their bill with a 51-vote majority using something called "budget reconciliation," though they'd prefer a bipartisan effort.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Yesterday, the Congressional Budget Office <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cbo-sees-stronger-u-recovery-160018504.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the US economy is recovering faster than expected, in part because of 2020 stimulus measures. Republicans could use that argument against Biden's larger package.  </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F02%2F01%2Frepublican-senators-meet-biden-relief-counterproposal" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LAW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/01/kirkland-elliss-2020-reportedly-best-year-yet?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TFW You Had a Great 2020
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Better Call Saul" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTE1L2JldHRlcl9jYWxsX3NhdWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Better Call Saul</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you're on the lookout for more pandemic winners, may we point you to Big Law. The world's highest-grossing law firm, Kirkland & Ellis, is on track to post <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/dcbd038f-23a3-4c8d-81e0-867ed84ea8a7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record annual revenue</a> of ~$5 billion for the 12 months ending in January, according to the Financial Times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>Even as the global economy sagged under the weight of shutdowns, Kirkland's three main areas of focus—private equity, restructuring, and litigation—all surged. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, with hyper-efficient Zoom meetings replacing four-dollar-sign client dinners, costs are way down...which means profits are way up.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a Wells Fargo </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/big-law-firms-prosper-despite-covid-impaired-economy-11601890200?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">survey</a></span><span> of 125 law firms, net income (revenue minus expenses) grew 25.6% annually in the first half of 2020.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Haunted by the 2008 financial crisis's blow to the industry, law firms quickly moved to cut pay and furlough staff when the pandemic arrived last spring. But due to the unexpected boost in business, they're back to padding wallets—firms paid junior staff bonuses of <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/b4ad9ec9-d8aa-4096-9940-95a76a1228cd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to $100,000</a> at the end of 2020.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/01/robinhood-raises-34b-shore-finances-amidst-historic-trading-volumes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Robinhood to Its Investors
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Man saying "gimme"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=369 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/mD4Z5Iz80f0Kv1vC5H/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Man saying "gimme"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/mD4Z5Iz80f0Kv1vC5H/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood has been busy <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-raises-another-2-4-billion-from-shareholders-11612197680?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fortifying its finances</a> in case Reddit traders decide to go sicko mode once more. The trading platform announced yesterday that it had raised another $2.4 billion from existing investors, and it's reportedly considering adding an additional $1 billion of debt in the coming days. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Mind-blowing stat of the day: </strong></span><span>Robinhood has raised more money since Thursday ($3.4 billion in total) than it has in the previous eight years of its existence. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood wants to make sure it has enough <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/31/robinhood-explains-reasons-halting-trading-meme-stocks-last-week?email={{profile.email}}&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collateral on hand</a> to cover its obligations to third-party partners that settle trades...which have been through the roof. On Friday, revenue-generating trades on the platform were 4x greater than last summer's average, according to the FT.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So doesn't that mean Robinhood is doing...well?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yes, and no. Despite the massive backlash across Twitter and Reddit, Robinhood is currently No. 1 on Apple's free app charts and was downloaded more than 600,000 times on Friday alone. But with great popularity comes great scrutiny; CEO Vlad Tenev is expected <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/02/01/robinhood-ceo-testify-maxine-waters-464491?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to testify</a> before the House Financial Services Committee on Feb. 18 about his company's role in the GameStop saga. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/01/private-jet-company-wheels-go-public-via-spac?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Private Jets Go Public
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Private jet" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTE4L3ByaXZhdGVfamV0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wheels Up, the so-called “Uber for private aviation,” is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/01/private-jet-company-wheels-up-to-go-public-in-a-2-billion-spac-deal-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">going public</a> via SPAC in a deal that values it at $2 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After the deal is completed, sometime in Q2, Wheels Up will become the first publicly traded standalone private jet company. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Running a private jet company is a lot less luxurious than flying in one; demand is inconsistent and maintaining a fleet of airplanes is expensive. But Wheels Up founder and CEO Kenny Dichter thinks the interest is there, and the industry just isn’t meeting it. “90% of the people who can afford to fly have not flown private jets,” he told CNBC. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The pandemic hasn’t hurt</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the broader commercial airline industry remains as fragile as a Biscoff cookie, data from Elite Traveler shows business flights (which the report classifies as any flights that aren’t commercial or cargo) are back to <a href="https://www.elitetraveler.com/cars-jets-and-yachts/aviation/private-jet-trends-upwards-covid-19-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">85%–90%</a> of their 2019 levels.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Travelers’ desire for on-demand, convenient, and, most importantly, sanitary flying conditions could be the wind beneath Wheels Up’s wings. But its trading debut will be a good barometer to see if investors think the pandemic bump = long-term adoption.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

Elsewhere, five more Italian regions \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/europe-italy-coronavirus-pandemic-rome-christmas-a62d49c28fb0034c5b3450f19ef983a2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelaxed restrictions\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e put in place before Christmas, allowing residents to visit the Vatican for the first time in 88 days. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nPUBLIC HEALTH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/01/essential-workers-look-clarity-around-vaccinations?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nEssential Doesn't Always Mean Priority\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Vaccines for essential workers\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTE2L3ZhY2NpbmVzX2Zvcl9lc3NlbnRpYWxfd29ya2Vycy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver the last two months, the US has administered about 30 million doses of coronavirus vaccines, with daily pricks now averaging 1.3+ million. Steady progress...but even as vaccinations tick up, millions of essential workers \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2021/01/31/covid-vaccine-who-should-go-first/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon't have clarity\u003c/a\u003e around when it's their turn.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe lines are blurry  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConcerns about a slow rollout prompted the Trump and Biden administrations to support expanding eligibility to all adults 65+ and frontline workers. Some states, including Texas and Florida, began vaccinating senior citizens as early as December. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Kaiser Family Foundation estimates that in at least 35 states, frontline workers have been prioritized with or behind older people. That’s prompted some \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2021-01-26/as-californis-shifts-to-age-based-covid-19-vaccine-essential-workers-disabled-n?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edebate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about using age-based factors vs. occupational risk and underlying health concerns. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere's a case for both. \u003c/strong\u003eThe panel that advises the CDC about vaccine priority recommended that, after healthcare personnel, frontline workers (who are more likely to contract and spread Covid) and adults 75+ (who are more likely to get serious complications and fill up ICUs) should get shots.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere's also a question of equity\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEssential workers, a disproportionate number of whom are people of color and immigrants, have experienced higher rates of Covid. Preliminary results of a UCSF study \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/pandemic-wears-on-essential-workers-everybody-forgets-that-youre-still-on-the-front-line-11612197832?mod=hp_lead_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efound\u003c/a\u003e a 39% increase in deaths among food and agriculture workers (compared to 22% among workers in general). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-01/democrats-probe-tyson-smithfield-osha-over-covid-outbreaks?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a probe into meatpacking plants operated by Tyson, Smithfield, and JBS. Almost 54,000 meatpacking employees have gotten sick, and at least 270 have died. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUncertainty over vaccines is yet another challenge for essential workers, many of whom are in a precarious financial position. While many grocery and retail giants recorded record profits during the pandemic, \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/blog/the-avenue/2021/01/27/local-covid-19-hazard-pay-mandates-are-doing-what-congress-and-most-corporations-arent-for-essential-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehazard pay\u003c/a\u003e for most grocery workers ran out months ago, even as the pandemic worsened.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e The struggle to immunize the heroes of the pandemic highlights the logistical, political, and moral questions around distributing a limited number of life-saving vaccines.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaybe hot cocoa and a snow day can bridge the deepest of divides. Yesterday, a group of Republican senators snowshoed over to the White House to discuss their \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/31/962554923/10-senate-republicans-plan-to-detail-slimmed-down-covid-19-counteroffer?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$618 billion counterproposal\u003c/a\u003e to President Biden's $1.9 trillion relief bill. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere are some familiar pieces inside, including: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$160 billion for vaccines, Covid testing and tracing, and PPE\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$220 billion for direct payments of up to $1,000 to some individuals (Biden has pushed for $1,400 payments)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$132 billion for extra unemployment benefits through June (Biden's would run through September)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAdditional funds for the PPP and reopening schools \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's not: \u003c/strong\u003eThe counterproposal leaves out a $15 federal minimum wage and aid for state/local governments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e10 Republicans are behind the proposal...precisely the number Democrats may need on their side to \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/29/will-democrats-finally-nix-filibuster?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprevent a filibuster\u003c/a\u003e. Democrats can pass their bill with a 51-vote majority using something called \"budget reconciliation,\" though they'd prefer a bipartisan effort.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday, the Congressional Budget Office \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/cbo-sees-stronger-u-recovery-160018504.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e the US economy is recovering faster than expected, in part because of 2020 stimulus measures. Republicans could use that argument against Biden's larger package.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you're on the lookout for more pandemic winners, may we point you to Big Law. The world's highest-grossing law firm, Kirkland \u0026 Ellis, is on track to post \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/dcbd038f-23a3-4c8d-81e0-867ed84ea8a7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord annual revenue\u003c/a\u003e of ~$5 billion for the 12 months ending in January, according to the Financial Times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eEven as the global economy sagged under the weight of shutdowns, Kirkland's three main areas of focus—private equity, restructuring, and litigation—all surged. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus, with hyper-efficient Zoom meetings replacing four-dollar-sign client dinners, costs are way down...which means profits are way up.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a Wells Fargo \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/big-law-firms-prosper-despite-covid-impaired-economy-11601890200?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurvey\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of 125 law firms, net income (revenue minus expenses) grew 25.6% annually in the first half of 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eHaunted by the 2008 financial crisis's blow to the industry, law firms quickly moved to cut pay and furlough staff when the pandemic arrived last spring. But due to the unexpected boost in business, they're back to padding wallets—firms paid junior staff bonuses of \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/b4ad9ec9-d8aa-4096-9940-95a76a1228cd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup to $100,000\u003c/a\u003e at the end of 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood has been busy \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-raises-another-2-4-billion-from-shareholders-11612197680?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efortifying its finances\u003c/a\u003e in case Reddit traders decide to go sicko mode once more. The trading platform announced yesterday that it had raised another $2.4 billion from existing investors, and it's reportedly considering adding an additional $1 billion of debt in the coming days. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMind-blowing stat of the day: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRobinhood has raised more money since Thursday ($3.4 billion in total) than it has in the previous eight years of its existence. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood wants to make sure it has enough \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/31/robinhood-explains-reasons-halting-trading-meme-stocks-last-week?email={{profile.email}}\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollateral on hand\u003c/a\u003e to cover its obligations to third-party partners that settle trades...which have been through the roof. On Friday, revenue-generating trades on the platform were 4x greater than last summer's average, according to the FT.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo doesn't that mean Robinhood is doing...well?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYes, and no. Despite the massive backlash across Twitter and Reddit, Robinhood is currently No. 1 on Apple's free app charts and was downloaded more than 600,000 times on Friday alone. But with great popularity comes great scrutiny; CEO Vlad Tenev is expected \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/02/01/robinhood-ceo-testify-maxine-waters-464491?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto testify\u003c/a\u003e before the House Financial Services Committee on Feb. 18 about his company's role in the GameStop saga. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F02%2F01%2Frobinhood-raises-34b-shore-finances-amidst-historic-trading-volumes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTE4L3ByaXZhdGVfamV0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWheels Up, the so-called “Uber for private aviation,” is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/01/private-jet-company-wheels-up-to-go-public-in-a-2-billion-spac-deal-.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egoing public\u003c/a\u003e via SPAC in a deal that values it at $2 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter the deal is completed, sometime in Q2, Wheels Up will become the first publicly traded standalone private jet company. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eRunning a private jet company is a lot less luxurious than flying in one; demand is inconsistent and maintaining a fleet of airplanes is expensive. But Wheels Up founder and CEO Kenny Dichter thinks the interest is there, and the industry just isn’t meeting it. “90% of the people who can afford to fly have not flown private jets,” he told CNBC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe pandemic hasn’t hurt\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile the broader commercial airline industry remains as fragile as a Biscoff cookie, data from Elite Traveler shows business flights (which the report classifies as any flights that aren’t commercial or cargo) are back to \u003ca href=\"https://www.elitetraveler.com/cars-jets-and-yachts/aviation/private-jet-trends-upwards-covid-19-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e85%–90%\u003c/a\u003e of their 2019 levels.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eTravelers’ desire for on-demand, convenient, and, most importantly, sanitary flying conditions could be the wind beneath Wheels Up’s wings. But its trading debut will be a good barometer to see if investors think the pandemic bump = long-term adoption.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
